comments:
The dramatic rise in the use of complementary and alternative medicine (CAM)
by the American public requires that the contemporary health care practitioner have an
awareness of CAM therapies and modalities currently available. The end result of this
course is not proficiency in the practice of any of these modalities in particular, but rather
a basic understanding of each approach to common conditions and their potential
contribution to health and well being. The focus of the CAM modalities discussed in this
course centers on their use in women's health care provision.
Students referred to this course as “excellent,” “phenomenal,” and “a ton of fun!”
They learned a surprising amount from the class and appreciated the exposure to a
different approach to medicine. More than one student suggested that the course should
be a requirement for all nursing students.
The guest lecturers received very mixed reviews. Some were excellent, while
others were unable to stimulate the students’ interest.
Students thought the assignments were relevant, and the grading was fair,
although one student would have appreciated more feedback.

The dramatic rise in the use of complementary and alternative medicine (CAM)
by the American public requires that the contemporary health care practitioner have an
awareness of CAM therapies and modalities currently available. The end result of this
course is not proficiency in the practice of any of these modalities in particular, but rather
a basic understanding of each approach to common conditions and their potential
contribution to health and well being. The focus of the CAM modalities discussed in this
course center on their use in women's health care provision.
Overall, students found this course to be “stimulating” and “very informative and
enjoyable.” Many students felt that the different speakers were a “ton of fun,” but others
felt that their “quality was variable.”
Many students praised Grube’s lecturing style, wishing that she “would lecture
more.” Students praised her “fair” grading, but they wished there was “more feedback on
assignments.”
Students felt that this course “should be a requirement for all NP students,” and
“provided much more for my arsenal” as an all-around useful course.
